tit.cmt: クオーテーションマークを除きました。

sen.j: 軍用手票（ぐんようしゅひょう）とは、戦争時において占領地もしくは勢力下にて軍隊が現地からの物資調達及びその他の支払いのために発行される擬似紙幣である。
sen.e: Gunyoshuhyo' is pseudo currency issued during wars for military forces to pay for commodities and other necessaries in its occupying areas or areas under their control.
Gunyoshuhyo is pseudo currency issued during wars for military forces to pay for commodities and other necessaries in its occupying areas or areas under their control.
sen.cmt: クオーテーションマークを除きました。
sen.e: Gunyoshuhyo is pseudo currency issued during wars for military forces to pay for commodities and other necessaries in its occupying areas or areas under their control.

sen.j: 政府紙幣の一種と解されることもある。
sen.e: It is sometimes interpreted as a kind of paper money issued by a government.
It is sometimes interpreted as a kind of paper money issued by a government.
It is sometimes interpreted as a kind of paper money issued by a government.

sen.j: 略して「軍票（ぐんぴょう）」とも呼ばれていることが一般的である。
sen.e: It is often called 'Gunpyo', for short,
It is often called 'Gunpyo,' for short,
sen.cmt: コンマの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: It is often called 'Gunpyo,' for short,

sen.j: 正確には領収書であり、最終的には、その軍隊が所属する政府によって軍票所持者に対し債務支払いを行う必要がある。
sen.e: To be precise, it is a receipt; the government of the army has to pay the money to owners of it eventually.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: To be precise, it is a receipt; the government of the army has to pay the money to owners of it eventually.
To be precise, it is a receipt; the government of the army has to pay the money to owners of it eventually.

sen.j: が、敗戦国の場合、支払能力がないため反故にされる場合もある。
sen.e: However, a defeated nation cannot pay the money, and in that case, its Gunpyo means nothing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, a defeated nation cannot pay the money, and in that case, its Gunpyo means nothing.
However, a defeated nation cannot pay the money, and in that case, its Gunpyo means nothing.

sen.j: また第二次世界大戦の敗戦国である日本の場合、かつて戦時国際法上、個人に対する戦争被害を敗戦国が補償する義務がなく、また連合国側が軍票の支払い義務を免除したため、後に国際問題になったことがある。
sen.e: When Japan was defeated in the second world war, it did not pay money to owners of Gunpyo, which led to an international problem; according to the international law of war at that time, defeated countries were not required to compensate for individual war damage and the Allies exempted Japan from the payment.

When Japan was defeated in World War II, according to the international law of war at that time, defeated countries were not required to compensate for individual war damage and the Allies exempted Japan from the payment, which led to an international problem.
sen.cmt: the second world war→World War II、it did not～Gunpyoの部分を除き、which～の部分を最後に付けました。
sen.e: When Japan was defeated in World War II, according to the international law of war at that time, defeated countries were not required to compensate for individual war damage and the Allies exempted Japan from the payment, which led to an international problem.

sen.j: 軍隊は食料などの物資を現地調達する。
sen.e: Military forces got food and other necessaries from the areas under their control.
Military forces got food and other necessaries by self-subsistence in the field.
Military forces got food and other necessaries by self-subsistence in the field.

sen.j: それは一方的な物資徴発、ともすれば略奪であった。
sen.e: They resorted to impressment, or sometimes forage.
It could be one-seded requisition of supplies, or sometimes plunder.
sen.cmt: 文章全体を修正しました。
sen.e: It could be one-seded requisition of supplies, or sometimes plunder.

sen.j: しかし、そのようなやり方は外聞が悪く、徴発相手の反感を招く。
sen.e: However, such methods were shameful and could cause antipathy from those who were pressed.
However, such methods were disreputable and could cause antipathy from those who were pressed.
sen.cmt: ここではshameful→disreputableの方が良いかと思い修正しました。
sen.e: However, such methods were disreputable and could cause antipathy from those who were pressed.

sen.j: そのため近代以降の戦争では各国軍隊が軍票によって物資を購入するという形をとるようになった。
sen.e: Therefore, in wars in modern times, each country's military force purchased commodities using military currency.
Therefore, in wars broken out in and after modern times, each country's military force purchased commodities using military currency.
sen.cmt: broken out, and after を加えました。
sen.e: Therefore, in wars broken out in and after modern times, each country's military force purchased commodities using military currency.

sen.j: つまり軍票は徴発した物資にたいする領収書であった。
sen.e: In short, military currency was a receipt for commodities the military force got.
In short, military currency was a receipt for commodities the military force got.
In short, military currency was a receipt for commodities the military force got.

sen.j: このように軍隊が所属する国家の通貨制度とは分離して軍票を使用する制度を用いるのは、自国の通貨を使用すると通貨供給量が激増し、結果的にはインフレーションで経済破綻する恐れがあるほか、敵国に自国通貨が渡ると工作資金になる危険性があるなど、戦略面からの要請があるためである。
sen.e: The reason a military force used their military currency instead of using their country's bank notes was as follows; the total money supply might increase drastically, which could lead to inflation and then economic disaster if they used their country's currency; the country's currency might be used for power-keeping maneuver if their enemy country got it.

The reason a military force used their military currency instead of using their own country's monetary system was as follows; the total money supply might increase drastically, which could lead to inflation and economic disaster if they used their own country's currency; the country's currency might be used for power-keeping maneuver if their enemy country got it.
sen.cmt: their country's bank notes→their own country's monetary system、their country's→their own country's としました。
sen.e: The reason a military force used their military currency instead of using their own country's monetary system was as follows; the total money supply might increase drastically, which could lead to inflation and economic disaster if they used their own country's currency; the country's currency might be used for power-keeping maneuver if their enemy country got it.

sen.j: また領収書であるため、手持の貴金属による支払いに比べ、実際の経済力以上の物資の徴発が可能でもある。
sen.e: In addition, since military currency was a receipt, it was possible to get more commodities than the military force could actually buy with its precious metal.
In addition, since military currency was a receipt, it was possible to get more commodities than the military force could actually buy with its precious metal.
In addition, since military currency was a receipt, it was possible to get more commodities than the military force could actually buy with its precious metal.

sen.j: そのため軍が勝手に印刷して流通させることも出来る。
sen.e: Therefore, military forces could issue and circulate as much military currency as they wanted.
Therefore, military forces could issue and circulate as much military currency as they wanted.
Therefore, military forces could issue and circulate as much military currency as they wanted.

sen.j: 以上のように、軍票は通貨のような体裁と流通形態をしていて、商品券のような物と誤解される場合があるが、法律上の扱いは法定通貨でも有価証券でもなく領収書であり、最終的には相手国政府当局に提出して現金化する事が必要である。
sen.e: Military currency (paper money) was sometimes mistaken as a voucher since it had an appearance and a circulation system as if it were usual paper money; however, legally, it was only a receipt, not a legal tender or marketable securities, and had to be encashed by the government of the military force.

As stated above, military currency was sometimes mistaken as a voucher since it had an appearance and a circulation system as if it were usual paper money; however, legally, it was only a receipt, not a legal tender or marketable securities, and had to be encashed by the government of the military force.
sen.cmt: 「以上のように」訳漏れ。As stated aboveを加え、 (paper money)を除きました。
sen.e: As stated above, military currency was sometimes mistaken as a voucher since it had an appearance and a circulation system as if it were usual paper money; however, legally, it was only a receipt, not a legal tender or marketable securities, and had to be encashed by the government of the military force.

sen.j: あくまで物資や労働力などを軍が受領し、軍に対して債権を持つことを証明する領収書に過ぎないものである。
sen.e: It was only a receipt to show that the military force had to pay for the commodities and/or labor to the owners of the military currency.
It was only a receipt to show that the military force had to pay for the commodities and/or labor to the owners of the military currency.
It was only a receipt to show that the military force had to pay for the commodities and/or labor to the owners of the military currency.

sen.j: ただし、期間と場所を限定した場合、軍票が通貨の代わりに流通した例もある。
sen.e: However, there were some examples that military currency did work as real currency in limited periods and areas.
However, there were some examples that military currency did work as real currency in limited periods and areas.
However, there were some examples that military currency did work as real currency in limited periods and areas.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦中には連合国側も発行していたほか、第二次世界大戦後もアメリカ合衆国が世界各地の米軍基地の兵士の給料として米ドル建ての軍票を、1970年代ごろまで支給し使用していた。
sen.e: During the WWII, the Allies issued their military currency, and after the WWII until the 1970's, the U.S.A. issued its military currency based on dollar and paid salary by that currency to its soldiers in U.S. military bases throughout the world.

During the WWII, the Allies issued their military currency, and after the WWII until the 1970's, the U.S.A. issued its military currency in US dollar and paid salary by that to the soldiers in U.S. military bases throughout the world.
sen.cmt: based on→in, dollar→US dollar、by that currency to its soldiers→by that to the soldiersとしました。
sen.e: During the WWII, the Allies issued their military currency, and after the WWII until the 1970's, the U.S.A. issued its military currency in US dollar and paid salary by that to the soldiers in U.S. military bases throughout the world.

sen.j: またベトナム戦争に派遣された韓国陸軍もベトナムで使用する軍票を発行していたほか、イギリス軍も世界各国の基地内で使用する軍票を発行していたこともある。
sen.e: When the army of South Korea was dispatched to Vietnam, they issued their military currency that could be used there; the British Armed Forces also issued their military currency that could be used in British military bases throughout the world.

When the army of South Korea was dispatched to Vietnam, they issued their military currency that could be used there; the British Armed Forces also issued their military currency that could be used in British military bases throughout the world.

When the army of South Korea was dispatched to Vietnam, they issued their military currency that could be used there; the British Armed Forces also issued their military currency that could be used in British military bases throughout the world.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦中のアメリカではAllied Military Currencyという軍用手票が発行されていた。
sen.e: During the WWII, Allied Military Currency was issued in the United States.
During the WWII, Allied Military Currency was issued in the United States.
During the WWII, Allied Military Currency was issued in the United States.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後からベトナム戦争の終わりまでMilitary Payment Certificate （略称MPC)という米ドル立て軍用手票が発行されベトナムで流通していた。
sen.e: After the WWII through the end of the Vietnam War, Military Payment Certificate (MPC, for short), based on the U.S. dollar, was issued and circulated in Vietnam.
After the WWII through the end of the Vietnam War, Military Payment Certificate (MPC, for short) in US dollar was issued and circulated in Vietnam.
sen.cmt: based on the U.S. dollar→in US dollarに修正し、コンマを除きました。
sen.e: After the WWII through the end of the Vietnam War, Military Payment Certificate (MPC, for short) in US dollar was issued and circulated in Vietnam.

sen.j: 同じくベトナム戦争に派遣された韓国軍も同様の軍票（アメリカ・ドル建）を使用していた。
sen.e: The military force of South Korea used the similar military currency (based on the U.S. dollar) when dispatched to Vietnam.
The military force of South Korea used the similar military currency (in US dollar) when dispatched to Vietnam.
sen.cmt: based on the U.S. dollar→in US dollarに修正しました。
sen.e: The military force of South Korea used the similar military currency (in US dollar) when dispatched to Vietnam.

sen.j: 1990年代になるとアメリカ軍は紙の軍用手票の発行を辞めプリペイドカード方式へと移行した。
sen.e: In the 1990's, American military forced stopped issuing paper military currency; instead they introduced a pre-paid card system.
In the 1990's, U.S. forces switched to a pre-paid card system instead of issuing paper military currency.
sen.cmt: American military forced→U.S. forcesとして、前後の文を入れ替えinstead of～で繋げました。
sen.e: In the 1990's, U.S. forces switched to a pre-paid card system instead of issuing paper military currency.

sen.j: 日本においては、西南戦争の際に西郷隆盛が使用した西郷札が軍票の最初であるとされる。
sen.e: It is said that Saigo-satsu bill, issued by Takamori SAIGO during the Seinan War, was the first military currency in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is said that Saigo-satsu bill, issued by Takamori SAIGO during the Seinan War, was the first military currency in Japan.
It is said that Saigo-satsu bill, issued by Takamori SAIGO during the Seinan War, was the first military currency in Japan.

sen.j: その後日清戦争や日露戦争、第一次世界大戦（青島攻略戦）などの対外戦争で日本政府が占領地で発行しており、太平洋戦争（大東亜戦争）では中国および東南アジアの占領地各地で現地通貨建てのものが使用された。
sen.e: Afterwards, during such wars against foreign countries as Sino-Japanese War, Russo-Japanese War and the first World War (the war for captureing Tsingtao), Japanese government issued its military currency in its occupied areas; during the Pacific War (The Greater East Asian War), Japanese military currency was issued in its occupying areas, including China and Southeast Asia, based on the local currency.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Afterwards, during such wars against foreign countries as Sino-Japanese War, Russo-Japanese War and the First World War (the war for captureing Tsingtao), Japanese government issued its military currency in the occupied areas and during the Pacific War (The Greater East Asian War), Japanese military currency was issued in the occupying areas, including China and Southeast Asia, based on the local currency.
sen.cmt: first→First, its→theに修正し、andを加えました。
sen.e: Afterwards, during such wars against foreign countries as Sino-Japanese War, Russo-Japanese War and the First World War (the war for captureing Tsingtao), Japanese government issued its military currency in the occupied areas and during the Pacific War (The Greater East Asian War), Japanese military currency was issued in the occupying areas, including China and Southeast Asia, based on the local currency.

sen.j: また戦後沖縄で使用されたB円も軍票の一種といえる。
sen.e: B yen,' used in Okinawa after the WWII, could be called a kind of military currency.
sen.cmt: B円の定訳が確認出来ませんでした。
sen.e: Type B Military Yen' used in Okinawa after the WWII, could be a kind of military currency.
sen.cmt: 「正式名はB型軍票。英語表記は、Type "B" Military Yenで、Yen B type、B-yenなどとも表記される。」とありましたので、Ｂ円の訳をその様に修正しました。calledを除きました。
sen.e: Type B Military Yen' used in Okinawa after the WWII, could be a kind of military currency.

sen.j: 前述のように軍票は、大蔵大臣や日本銀行の許可は要らず、軍が勝手に印刷して流通させることが出来る。
sen.e: As mentioned before, military currency could be issued and circulated by the military force without the permission of Ministry of Finance or Bank of Japan.
As mentioned above, military currency could be issued and circulated by the military force without the permission of Ministry of Finance or Bank of Japan.
As mentioned above, military currency could be issued and circulated by the military force without the permission of Ministry of Finance or Bank of Japan.

sen.j: そのため、第二次世界大戦では日本軍の各軍団が勝手に軍用手票を乱発して経済的混乱を招く結果となった。
sen.e: During the WWII, many an army group issued its military currency by its own judgment, which resulted in economic chaos.
Therefore, during the WWII, each of Japanese army groups overissued the military currency by their own judgment, which resulted in economic chaos.
sen.cmt: Thereforeを加え、many an army group→each of Japanese army groups、issued→overissued、its→their に修正しました。
sen.e: Therefore, during the WWII, each of Japanese army groups overissued the military currency by their own judgment, which resulted in economic chaos.

sen.j: 中国戦線で使用した日本円以外にもペソやギルダーなどのさまざまな通貨単位の軍用手票が各占領地で発行された。
sen.e: Not only the military currency, based on Japanese yen and used during the China-Japan battles, but also other kinds of military currency, based on various currency units such as peso and guilder, were issued in the Japan-occupied areas.

Not only the military currency in Japanese yen used during the China-Japan battles, but also other kinds of military currency in various currency units such as peso and guilder were issued in the Japan-occupied areas.
sen.cmt: コンマ、andを除きました。based on→in に修正しました。
sen.e: Not only the military currency in Japanese yen used during the China-Japan battles, but also other kinds of military currency in various currency units such as peso and guilder were issued in the Japan-occupied areas.

sen.j: 中には南方開発金庫などの日本が設立した現地金融機関が発行した場合もあった。
sen.e: Some military currency was issued by 'Financial Cooperation for Developing Southern Areas,' which was established by Japanese government in its occupying area.
sen.cmt: 「南方開発金庫」の定訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Some military currency was issued by a local financial institution such as 'The Southern Development Bank' which was established by Japanese government.
sen.cmt: in its occupying areを除き、代りに「現地金融機関」a local financial institution such as を加えました。「南方開発金庫」の訳が載っていたのでその通りに修正しました。http://www18.ocn.ne.jp/~jmn/index.html
sen.e: Some military currency was issued by a local financial institution such as 'The Southern Development Bank' which was established by Japanese government.

sen.j: また、対ソ戦を想定しルーブル表示の軍票も試作されたが、実際に使われること無く消滅した。
sen.e: Military currency that seemed to be based on ruble was made experimentally but it disappeared without being used at all.
Military currency based on ruble was made experimentally on the assumption that they would fought with the Soviet Union, but it disappeared without being used at all.
sen.cmt: 「対ソ戦を想定し」の部分の訳漏れ。that seemed to beを除き、on the assumption～the Soviet Union の部分を加えました。
sen.e: Military currency based on ruble was made experimentally on the assumption that they would fought with the Soviet Union, but it disappeared without being used at all.

sen.j: 日本貨幣商協同組合『日本貨幣カタログ2007』によれば、日本軍が発行した軍票を次のシリーズに分類している。
sen.e: According to "Japanese Currency Catalog, 2007" published by Japanese Currency Merchant Association, the militay currencies issued by Japanese military force were classified into the following.
sen.cmt: 「日本貨幣商協同組合」および『日本貨幣カタログ』の定訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: According to "The Catalog of Japanese Coins and Bank Notes 2007" published by Japan Numismatic Dealers Association, the militay currencies issued by Japanese military force were classified into the following.
sen.cmt: 「日本貨幣商協同組合」=Japan Numismatic Dealers Association、「日本貨幣カタログ」=The Catalog of Japanese Coins and Bank Notes と共に載っていたのでその様に修正しました。http://www.jnda.or.jp/
sen.e: According to "The Catalog of Japanese Coins and Bank Notes 2007" published by Japan Numismatic Dealers Association, the militay currencies issued by Japanese military force were classified into the following.

sen.j: なお、日清戦争から日華事変甲号軍票までは明治時代に発行された明治通宝とよばれる政府紙幣のデザインを踏襲した縦型のものを使っていたが、その後は銀行券スタイルのものが発行されるようになった。
sen.e: From the military currency used during Sino-Japanese War through Ko-go currency used during the China Incident, vertical style was adopted, after Meiji Tsuho, a government-issued bank note; afterwards, however, bank-note styled military currencies were issued.
sen.cmt: 「甲号軍票」定訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: The military currency used during Sino-Japanese War through Ko-go currency used during the China Incident, vertical style ones followed a design of the government-issued bank note called Meiji Tsuho was adopted, but bank-note styled military currencies were issued afterwards.
sen.cmt: Fromを除き、vertical styleの後にones followed～を加え文の構成を少し修正し、afterwardsを最後に持って行きました。
sen.e: The military currency used during Sino-Japanese War through Ko-go currency used during the China Incident, vertical style ones followed a design of the government-issued bank note called Meiji Tsuho was adopted, but bank-note styled military currencies were issued afterwards.

sen.j: 日清戦争軍票（両単位）
sen.e: Sino-Japanese War Military Currency (based on Ryo)
Sino-Japanese War Military Currency (in a currency unit, Ryo)
sen.cmt: based on→in a currency unit としました。
sen.e: Sino-Japanese War Military Currency (in a currency unit, Ryo)

sen.j: 1895年に勃発した日清戦争で発行、10両、5両、1両、5銭、2銭5分の清時代の通貨単位の軍票を1895年2月に発行した。
sen.e: It was issued when Sino-Japanese War broke out in 1895; the following were issued in February, 1895, based on the currency units in Qing period; ten ryo, five ryo, one ryo, five sen, and two sen and five bu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The military currency in the currency of the Qing period; ten ryo, five ryo, one ryo, five sen, and two sen and five bu was issued in February, 1895 when Sino-Japanese War broke out in 1895.
sen.cmt: the following were issuedの部分を除き、based on the currency unit→in the currency of として、文全体の構成を修正しました。
sen.e: The military currency in the currency of the Qing period; ten ryo, five ryo, one ryo, five sen, and two sen and five bu was issued in February, 1895 when Sino-Japanese War broke out in 1895.

sen.j: が、戦争が予想よりも速く終結し、あまり軍票を発行することがなかったため、ほぼ全量が回収された。
sen.e: However, the war was terminated earlier than expected, and little military currency was issued, almost all of which was collected.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, since the war was terminated earlier than expected and few military currency was issued, almost all of which were collected.
sen.cmt: little→few, was→were とし、sinceを加えました。
sen.e: However, since the war was terminated earlier than expected and few military currency was issued, almost all of which were collected.

sen.j: そのため現存するのは1両軍票数枚という珍品である。
sen.e: Therefore, that military currency is a rare article; there remain only a few pieces of one-ryo military currency.
Therefore, that military currency is a rare article, which remains only a few pieces of one-ryo military currency.
Therefore, that military currency is a rare article, which remains only a few pieces of one-ryo military currency.

sen.j: 日露戦争軍票（銀円単位）
sen.e: Russo-Japanese War Military Currency (convertible into silver)
Russo-Japanese War Military Currency (convertible into silver)
Russo-Japanese War Military Currency (convertible into silver)

sen.j: 日露関係険悪化のため、戦争開始前に用意されていたため、日露戦争開始直後の1905年2月に発行。
sen.e: Since Japanese government prepared that military currency before the war, due to the aggravated Russo-Japan relationship, it was issued in February 1905, soon after the beginning of the war.
Since Japanese government prepared that military currency before the war, due to the aggravated Russo-Japan relationship, it was issued in February 1905, soon after the beginning of the war.
Since Japanese government prepared that military currency before the war, due to the aggravated Russo-Japan relationship, it was issued in February 1905, soon after the beginning of the war.

sen.j: 清国や朝鮮で使用するために、朝鮮語（ハングル）による表記がされていた。
sen.e: It was written in hangeul so that it could be used in Qing and Korea.
It was written in Hangeul so that it could be used in Qing and Korea.
It was written in Hangeul so that it could be used in Qing and Korea.

sen.j: 10円、5円、1円、50銭、20銭、10銭が発行され大量に流通した。
sen.e: The currencies of 10 yen, 5 yen, 1 yen, 50 sen, 20 sen, and 10 sen were issued and distributed in large quantities.
The currencies of 10 yen, 5 yen, 1 yen, 50 sen, 20 sen, and 10 sen were issued and distributed in large quantities.
The currencies of 10 yen, 5 yen, 1 yen, 50 sen, 20 sen, and 10 sen were issued and distributed in large quantities.

sen.j: 戦後多くが回収されたが、従軍した日本軍兵士が低額券を戦勝記念に持ち帰ったため、比較的入手しやすい。
sen.e: That currency was relatively accessible; although most of them were collected after the war, quite a few Japanese soldiers who fought in the war brought back low-priced notes.
Although most of them were collected after the war, quite a few Japanese soldiers who fought in the war brought back low-priced notes so the currency was relatively obtainable.
sen.cmt: That currency～→the currencyとして文の最後に持っていき、accessible→obtainable としました。
sen.e: Although most of them were collected after the war, quite a few Japanese soldiers who fought in the war brought back low-priced notes so the currency was relatively obtainable.

sen.j: 戦地で軍票額面価格を維持するために、いつでも正銀貨と引換を希望すれば、戦地所在の横浜正金銀行各支店、内地指定の金庫、韓国金庫派出所、野戦郵便局、韓国、北中国所在の日本普通郵便局、第一銀行出張所で軍票を受入れた。
sen.e: In order to keep the nominal value of that military currency, the Japanese government made it possible for the owners to exchange the currency with silver at every branch of Yokohama Shokin Bank, assigned banks in Japan, detached offices of Korean Bank, Yasen (open battle) Post Office, Japanese common post offices at Korea and nothern China and detached offices of First Bank.
sen.cmt: 横浜正金銀行各支店、内地指定の金庫、韓国金庫派出所、野戦郵便局、韓国、北中国所在の日本普通郵便局、第一銀行出張所の定訳が確認出来ませんでした。
sen.e: In order to keep the nominal value of that military currency, the Japanese government made it possible for the owners to exchange the currency with silver at every branch of Yokohama Specie Bank, Ltd. located at the front, assigned depositories in Japan, detached offices of Korean depository, Yasen (open battle) Post Office, Japanese common post offices at Korea and nothern China and detached offices of First Bank.
sen.cmt: 「戦地所在の」訳漏れ、located at the front を加えました。「金庫」はbank→depositoryとしました。「横浜正金銀行」の英語表記がありましたので、その様に修正しました。http://www18.ocn.ne.jp/~jmn/others/yokohama_specie.html
sen.e: In order to keep the nominal value of that military currency, the Japanese government made it possible for the owners to exchange the currency with silver at every branch of Yokohama Specie Bank, Ltd. located at the front, assigned depositories in Japan, detached offices of Korean depository, Yasen (open battle) Post Office, Japanese common post offices at Korea and nothern China and detached offices of First Bank.

sen.j: 明治38年6月末までに軍票の発行高は金1億4054万5000円であった。
sen.e: The issued amount of military currency reached 14,054,5000 yen by the end of June, 1905.
The issued amount of military currency reached 140,545,000 yen by the end of June, 1905.
The issued amount of military currency reached 140,545,000 yen by the end of June, 1905.

sen.j: 青島出兵軍票（銀円単位）
sen.e: Military Currency in Sending Troops to Tsingtao (convertible into silver)
Military Currency in Sending Troops to Tsingtao (convertible into silver)
Military Currency in Sending Troops to Tsingtao (convertible into silver)

sen.j: 第一次世界大戦勃発に伴い、日英同盟に基づき日本はドイツ帝国に宣戦布告。
sen.e: At the outbreak of the WWI, Japan, based on Anglo-Japanese Alliance Treaty, declared war on German Empire.
At the outbreak of the WWI, Japan, based on Anglo-Japanese Alliance Treaty, declared war on German Empire.
At the outbreak of the WWI, Japan, based on Anglo-Japanese Alliance Treaty, declared war on German Empire.

sen.j: 当時ドイツが中国に持っていた山東半島の租借地を占領する軍事作戦を展開したが、この時に占領地で使用するために1914年9月に10円、5円、1円、50銭、20銭、10銭が発行された。
sen.e: When the Japanese military force executed a military operation in order to occupy the former German-leased territory in Shandong Peninsula, it issued the following military currency (notes) in September, 1914, to be used there; 10 yen, 5 yen, one yen, 50 sen, 20 sen and 10 sen.

When the Japanese military force executed a military operation in order to occupy the former German-leased territory in Shandong Peninsula of China, the military currency for 10 yen, 5 yen, one yen, 50 sen, 20 sen and 10 sen were issued to be used in the occupied territory in September, 1914.
sen.cmt: 「中国に」の訳漏れ、of Chinaを加え、「占領地で」→occupied territoryとしました。後半部分の主語をthe military currencyとして文を修正しました。
sen.e: When the Japanese military force executed a military operation in order to occupy the former German-leased territory in Shandong Peninsula of China, the military currency for 10 yen, 5 yen, one yen, 50 sen, 20 sen and 10 sen were issued to be used in the occupied territory in September, 1914.

sen.j: 1926年の統計によれば青島出兵で発行された総金額は11,812,197円で、そのうち161,956円が未回収とされている。
sen.e: Accordring to the statistics in 1926, the total amount of the military currency issued in sending troops to Tsingtao was 11,812, 197 yen, 161,956 of which was not realized.
Accordring to the statistics in 1926, the total amount of the military currency issued in sending troops to Tsingtao was 11,812, 197 yen, and 161,956 of which was not uncollected.
Accordring to the statistics in 1926, the total amount of the military currency issued in sending troops to Tsingtao was 11,812, 197 yen, and 161,956 of which was not uncollected.

sen.j: そのため残存数が少なく比較的高価なプレミアで取引をされている。
sen.e: The remaining currency is small in number, and these notes are treated at relatively high prices with premium,
The remaining currency is small in number, and these notes are treated at relatively high prices with premium,
The remaining currency is small in number, and these notes are treated at relatively high prices with premium,

sen.j: シベリア出兵軍票（金円単位）
sen.e: Military Currency in Sending Troops to Syberia (convertible into gold)
Military Currency in Sending Troops to Syberia (convertible into gold)
Military Currency in Sending Troops to Syberia (convertible into gold)

sen.j: 第一次世界大戦末期にロシア11月革命が発生し、史上初の社会主義政権が誕生した。
sen.e: At the end of the WWI, the Russian November Revolution broke out, which led to the birth of the first ever socialist regime.
At the end of the WWI, the Russian November Revolution broke out, which led to the birth of the first ever socialist regime.
At the end of the WWI, the Russian November Revolution broke out, which led to the birth of the first ever socialist regime.

sen.j: 皇帝派と革命政権派が激しい内戦が行われたが、世界の列強がチェコスロバキア軍救援を口実にシベリアに出兵した。
sen.e: The Emperor followers and revolutionary regime groups had the bitter civil strife, during which world powers sent their troops to Syberia on the pretense of assisting Czechoslovakian military force.
The Emperor followers and revolutionary regime groups had the bitter civil strife, and world powers sent their troops to Syberia on the pretense of assisting Czechoslovakian military force.
The Emperor followers and revolutionary regime groups had the bitter civil strife, and world powers sent their troops to Syberia on the pretense of assisting Czechoslovakian military force.

sen.j: 日本もシベリアに出兵したが、シベリアや北満州で使用するために1919年8月に金兌換を保証した10円、5円、1円、50銭、20銭、10銭が発行された。
sen.e: Japan also sent its troops to Syberia and issued in August, 1919, the following military currency (notes) to be used in Syberia and northern Manchuria; 10 yen, 5 yen, one yen, 50 sen, 20 sen, and 10 sen, all of which were guaranteed convertible to gold.

Japan also sent its troops to Syberia and issued the military currency (notes) such as 10 yen, 5 yen, one yen, 50 sen, 20 sen, and 10 sen to be used in Syberia and northern Manchuria, which were guaranteed convertible to gold, in August, 1919.
sen.cmt: in August, 1919を文の最後に、following、all of を除いて全体を修正しました。
sen.e: Japan also sent its troops to Syberia and issued the military currency (notes) such as 10 yen, 5 yen, one yen, 50 sen, 20 sen, and 10 sen to be used in Syberia and northern Manchuria, which were guaranteed convertible to gold, in August, 1919.

sen.j: そのため、日本語とともにロシア語による表記がなされている。
sen.e: On each note, both Japanese and Russian were printed.
Therefore, both Japanese and Russian were printed on them.
sen.cmt: On each note→Thereforeとし、on them を加えました。
sen.e: Therefore, both Japanese and Russian were printed on them.

sen.j: 日華事変軍票（銀円単位）
sen.e: The China Incident Military Currency (convertible into silver)
The China Incident Military Currency (convertible into silver)
The China Incident Military Currency (convertible into silver)

sen.j: 1931年の満州事変以後、日本に対する中華民国の排日運動が激化していったが、日本軍部が「治安の維持」を口実に暴走し、中国大陸への派兵と侵略を進めていった。
sen.e: After theManchurian Inciden in 1931, anti-Japanese movements in China became more serious, and the Japanese military sent its troops to China to invade the country; the Japanese military went out of control on on the pretense of keeping 'public security.'

After the Manchurian Inciden in 1931, anti-Japanese movements in China became more serious, and the Japanese military sent its troops to China to invade the country; the Japanese military went out of control on the pretense of keeping 'public security.'
sen.cmt: on を一つ除きました。theManchurian→スペースを加えました。
sen.e: After the Manchurian Inciden in 1931, anti-Japanese movements in China became more serious, and the Japanese military sent its troops to China to invade the country; the Japanese military went out of control on the pretense of keeping 'public security.'

sen.j: 1937年には日華事変（日中戦争）が勃発し、事実上全面戦争に突入した。
sen.e: The China Incident (China-Japan war) broke out in 1937, and escalated into an all-out war as a matter of practice.
The China Incident (China-Japan war) broke out in 1937, and escalated into an all-out war as a matter of practice.
The China Incident (China-Japan war) broke out in 1937, and escalated into an all-out war as a matter of practice.

sen.j: 当時の中国では満州では日系の朝鮮銀行券（日本円と等価）が流通しており、上海では日本銀行券も流通していた。
sen.e: In those days, in Manchuria, Japan-related Korean bank notes (equivalent to Japanese yen) were circulated and in Shanghai, Japanese bank notes were circulated.
In those days, in Manchuria, Japan-related Korean bank notes (equivalent to Japanese yen) were circulated and in Shanghai, Japanese bank notes were circulated.
In those days, in Manchuria, Japan-related Korean bank notes (equivalent to Japanese yen) were circulated and in Shanghai, Japanese bank notes were circulated.

sen.j: そのため、日本軍は戦争の進展に応じて様々な軍票や傀儡政権下の中国聯合準備銀行や中央儲備銀行が発行した銀行券も使用していた。
sen.e: So, Japanese military, according to the development of the war, used various kinds of military currency, as well as the currency issued by 中国聯合準備銀行 and 中央儲備銀行, controlled by the then puppet government.
sen.cmt: 「中国聯合準備銀行」「中央儲備銀行」の定訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: So, Japanese military, according to the development of the war, used various kinds of military currency, as well as the bank notes issued by Federal Reserve Bank Of China and Central Reserve Bank Of China under the then puppet government.
sen.cmt: 「銀行券」→bank notes, controlled by→under としました。「中国聯合準備銀行」「中央儲備銀行」の英語表記がありましたので、その様に修正しました。http://www18.ocn.ne.jp/~jmn/index.html
sen.e: So, Japanese military, according to the development of the war, used various kinds of military currency, as well as the bank notes issued by Federal Reserve Bank Of China and Central Reserve Bank Of China under the then puppet government.

sen.j: そのため、軍票だけでも多くのシリーズがあり、種類も多い。
sen.e: That is why they issued various series and kins of military currency.
That is why they issued various series and kins of military currency.
That is why they issued various series and kins of military currency.

sen.j: 甲号券 日本軍が従来発行していたスタイルの縦型の軍票。
sen.e: Ko-go notes; a traditional, vertical note.
sen.cmt: 甲号券の定訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Kogo-ken Notes; a traditional, vertical note.
Kogo-ken Notes; a traditional, vertical note.

sen.j: 1937年に発行されたが、デザインが陳腐していたため、額面300万円しか使われなかった。
sen.e: That currency was issued in 1937 but the total sum equivalent to only three million yen was used due to its commonplace design.
That currency was issued in 1937 but the total sum equivalent to only three million yen was used due to its commonplace design.
That currency was issued in 1937 but the total sum equivalent to only three million yen was used due to its commonplace design.

sen.j: 乙号券 当時の日本銀行兌換券の文字を抹消し、「軍用手票」と大きく印刷して発行。
sen.e: Otsu-go notes; the Japanese bank notes at that time was used; the letters printed on the notes were erased and the large letters of 'military currency' were printed on the surfaces.
sen.cmt: 乙号券の定訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Otsugo-ken Notes; the letteres printed on the Japanese bank notes at that time were erased and the large letters of 'military currency' were printed on the surfaces to be issued.
sen.cmt: Otsu-go notes→Otsugo-ken Notesとしました。the lettersを主語にして文を修正、to be issued を加えました。
sen.e: Otsugo-ken Notes; the letteres printed on the Japanese bank notes at that time were erased and the large letters of 'military currency' were printed on the surfaces to be issued.

sen.j: 丙号券 日本銀行の文字を印刷していない紙幣に「大日本帝国政府軍用手票」の文字を印刷して発行。
sen.e: Hei-go notes; the Japanese bank notes at that time was used; instead of 'Currency of Japanese Bank', 'Military Currency by the Government of the Empire of Japan' was printed.
sen.cmt: 丙号券の定訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Heigo-ken Notes; the Japanese bank notes, which were not printed the letters of 'Bank of Japan,' were issued with the letters 'Military Currency by the Government of the Empire of Japan' printed.
sen.cmt: at that timeを除き、Hei-go notes→Heigo-ken Notes、「日本銀行」Currency of Japanese Bank→Bank of Japanに修正し、文全体を原文に近づけるよう修正しました。
sen.e: Heigo-ken Notes; the Japanese bank notes, which were not printed the letters of 'Bank of Japan,' were issued with the letters 'Military Currency by the Government of the Empire of Japan' printed.

sen.j: 丁号券 鳳凰や龍といったデザインに変更した「大日本帝国政府軍票手票」として発行。
sen.e: Tei-go notes: the pictures of Chinese phoenix and dragons were printed and it was issued as 'Military Currency by the Government of the Empire of Japan.'
Teigo-ken Notes: the pictures of Chinese phoenix and dragons were printed and it was issued as 'Military Currency by the Government of the Empire of Japan.'
sen.cmt: Tei-go notes→Teigo-ken Notes としました。
sen.e: Teigo-ken Notes: the pictures of Chinese phoenix and dragons were printed and it was issued as 'Military Currency by the Government of the Empire of Japan.'

sen.j: 戊号券 丁号券の表記を「大日本帝国政府」に変更して発行
sen.e: I-go notes: Tei-go notes was used and the letters on the note was changed into ' the Government of the Empire of Japan.'
Igo-ken Notes: the letters printed on Teigo-ken Notes were changed into 'the Government of the Empire of Japan' to be issued.
sen.cmt: I-go notes→Igo-ken Notesとして、the lettersを主語にして文を修正しました。余分なスペースを除きました。
sen.e: Igo-ken Notes: the letters printed on Teigo-ken Notes were changed into 'the Government of the Empire of Japan' to be issued.

sen.j: ろ号券 戊号券のうち「ろ」で始まる記号があるもの。
sen.e: Ro-go notes: of the I-go notes, notes with signs that started with 'Ro.'
Rogo-ken Notes: it has signs that started with 'Ro' of Igo-ken Notes.
sen.cmt: Ro-go notes→Rogo-ken Notesとして、of the I-go notesを後ろに持って行き分を修正しました。
sen.e: Rogo-ken Notes: it has signs that started with 'Ro' of Igo-ken Notes.

sen.j: 仏領インドシナで使う目的の軍票であったが、殆ど使用されなかった。
sen.e: Although the military currency was issued in order to be used in French Indochina, very few notes were used.
Although the military currency was issued in order to be used in French Indochina, very few notes were used.
Although the military currency was issued in order to be used in French Indochina, very few notes were used.

sen.j: そのため比較的高価なプレミアが付いている。
sen.e: At present, the notes are sold at comparatively high prices with premium.
Therefore, the notes are sold at comparatively high prices with premium.
Therefore, the notes are sold at comparatively high prices with premium.

sen.j: 大東亜戦争軍票（各国単位）

The Military Currencies issued during The Greater East Asia War (in a monetary unit of each country)
sen.cmt: based on→in a monetary unit としました。
sen.e: The Military Currencies issued during The Greater East Asia War (in a monetary unit of each country)

sen.j: 1941年以後に日本軍が占領したアジア太平洋地域の各地で発行された軍票。
sen.e: They various kinds of military currencyies issued in various Asian Pacific areas the Japanese army occupied after 1941.
It is the military currency issued in various Asian Pacific areas where the Japanese army occupied after 1941.
sen.cmt: They various kinds of→It is として、where を加えました。currencyies→currency に修正しました。
sen.e: It is the military currency issued in various Asian Pacific areas where the Japanese army occupied after 1941.

sen.j: 各占領地域で発行されたため、軍票の通貨単位も異なり、多くのシリーズがあり、種類が多い。
sen.e: Since they were issued in many Japan-occupied areas, the units of currency varied and there were various series and kinds.
Since they were issued in many Japan-occupied areas, the monetary unit of military currency varied and there were various series and kinds.
sen.cmt: the units→the monetary unit, currency→military currency としました。
sen.e: Since they were issued in many Japan-occupied areas, the monetary unit of military currency varied and there were various series and kinds.

sen.j: は号券 蘭領インドシナで発行。
sen.e: Ha-go notes; issued in Dutch Indochina.
Hago-ken Notes; It was issued in Dutch Indochina.

sen.e: Ni-go notes; issued in British Malaya.
Nigo-ken Notes; It was issued in British Malaya.

sen.j: 単位は海峡ドル

sen.j: ほ号券 米領フィリピンで発行。
sen.e: Ho-go notes; issued in American Phillipines.
Hogo-ken Notes; It was issued in American Phillipines.

sen.j: 単位はペソ
sen.e: The currency unit was peso.
The currency unit was peso.
The currency unit was peso.

sen.j: へ号券 英領ビルマで発行。
sen.e: He-go notes; issued in British Burma.
Hego-ken Notes; It was issued in British Burma.
sen.cmt: He-go notes→Hego-ken Notesとして、It was を加えました。

sen.j: 単位はルピー
sen.e: The currency unit was rupee.
The currency unit was rupee.
The currency unit was rupee.

sen.j: と号券 英領太平洋地域で発行。
sen.e: To-go notes; issued in the Pacific areas colonized by Britain.
Togo-ken Notes; It was issued in the Pacific areas colonized by Britain.

sen.j: 単位はポンド
sen.e: The currency unit was pound.
The currency unit was pound.
The currency unit was pound.

sen.j: ハーグ陸戦条約第52条に「現品を供給させる場合には、住民に対して即金を支払わなければならない」、「それが出来ない場合には領収書を発行して速やかに支払いを履行すること」と書かれており、この領収書として用いられているのが、軍用手票である。
sen.e: Hague Convention, Article No. 52, says "Contributions in kind shall as far as possible be paid for in cash; if not, a receipt shall be given and the payment of the amount due shall be made as soon as possible."; military currency was used as the receipt mentioned above.

Hague Convention, Article No. 52, says 'Contributions in kind shall as far as possible be paid for in cash; if not, a receipt shall be given and the payment of the amount due shall be made as soon as possible.'; military currency was used as the receipt mentioned above.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを除き、クオーテーションマークを修正しました。
sen.e: Hague Convention, Article No. 52, says 'Contributions in kind shall as far as possible be paid for in cash; if not, a receipt shall be given and the payment of the amount due shall be made as soon as possible.'; military currency was used as the receipt mentioned above.

sen.j: 「軍票による支払等の許可の申請手続に関する省令」により、日本人が日本から外国に対して軍票による支払いを行う場合には、財務大臣の許可を受ける必要がある。
sen.e: According to "the departmental order about the application procedure of permission such as the payment by the military script," when a Japanese person living in Japan requires the payment by the military currency from a foreign country, that Japanese person has to get a permission from Finance Minister.

According to 'the departmental order about the application procedure of permission such as the payment by the military script,' when a Japanese person living in Japan is required the payment by the military currency to a foreign country, that Japanese person has to get a permission from Finance Minister.
sen.cmt: requires→is required, from→to, としました。
sen.e: According to 'the departmental order about the application procedure of permission such as the payment by the military script,' when a Japanese person living in Japan is required the payment by the military currency to a foreign country, that Japanese person has to get a permission from Finance Minister.

sen.j: 現在ではこの手続きはオンラインでも受け付けているが、オンライン申請された実績は無い。
sen.e: Nowadays, the application can be done online; no request has been made online so far.
Nowadays, the application can be done online but no request has been made online so far.
Nowadays, the application can be done online but no request has been made online so far.

sen.j: この省令が言うところの軍票とはＧＨＱと在日米軍が日本国内で使用した軍票の扱いに関してであり、大日本帝国が発行した軍票のことではない。
sen.e: The military script in the order mentioned above means the military currency used by GHQ and US military in Japan, and not the military currency issued by the Empire of Japan.
The military script in the order mentioned above means the military currency used by GHQ and US military in Japan, and not the military currency issued by the Empire of Japan.
The military script in the order mentioned above means the military currency used by GHQ and US military in Japan, and not the military currency issued by the Empire of Japan.

sen.j: 本来の趣旨はアメリカ軍から軍票による支払いを受けた日本企業がアメリカに対して支払いを行う場合の手続きを定めている。
sen.e: The purpose of the order was to determine the procedure for Japanese companies that were paid by American military currency to apply for the payment.
The purpose of the order was to determine the procedure for Japanese companies that were paid by American military currency to apply for the payment.
The purpose of the order was to determine the procedure for Japanese companies that were paid by American military currency to apply for the payment.

sen.j: 当時はドルの持ち出し制限があったため、その関連事項でもある。
sen.e: The order was related with the dollar restriction, which was valid when the order was issued.
The order was related with the dollar restriction, which was valid when the order was issued.
The order was related with the dollar restriction, which was valid when the order was issued.

sen.j: 現在、アメリカ軍は軍票を発行していないので、今後も申請されることは無いと思われる。
sen.e: At present, American army does not issue its military currency, so there will be no application.
At present, American army does not issue its military currency, so there seems to be no possibility of application.
sen.cmt: there will be no→there seems to be～としました。
sen.e: At present, American army does not issue its military currency, so there seems to be no possibility of application.

tit.e: Problems related with Japanese military currency
Problems related with Japanese military currency
Problems related with Japanese military currency

sen.j: 日本軍が発行した軍票は、敗戦により紙切れと化した。
sen.e: The military currency issued by Japanese military force ceased to be in effect due to Japanese defeat in the WWII..
The military currency issued by Japanese military force ceased to be in effect due to Japanese defeat in the WWII..
The military currency issued by Japanese military force ceased to be in effect due to Japanese defeat in the WWII..

sen.j: 発行数量が多すぎたため、一部ではインフレーションで実質的価値が消滅したのもあった。
sen.e: Since there was too much military currency, which led to inflation, the real value of some notes disappeared.
Since there was too much military currency issued, some of them became worthless due to inflation.
sen.cmt: which以降の文を修正しました。
sen.e: Since there was too much military currency issued, some of them became worthless due to inflation.

sen.j: 特にインフレが激しかった地域では、タバコの巻紙に軍票が使われたといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that some currencies were used to wrap tabacco leaves in areas where inflation was especially severe,
It is said that some currencies were used to wrap tabacco leaves in areas where inflation was especially severe.
sen.cmt: コンマをピリオドに修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that some currencies were used to wrap tabacco leaves in areas where inflation was especially severe.

sen.j: 軍票に対する日本政府の支払い義務は、連合国がサンフランシスコ講和条約で請求権を放棄したため、消滅したとされている。
sen.e: It is considered that Japanese government was released from obligation to pay for its military currency since the Allies exempted Japan from the payment when Japan signed the San Francisco Peace Treaty.

It is considered that Japanese government was released from obligation to pay for its military currency since the Allies exempted Japan from the payment when Japan signed the San Francisco Peace Treaty.

It is considered that Japanese government was released from obligation to pay for its military currency since the Allies exempted Japan from the payment when Japan signed the San Francisco Peace Treaty.

sen.j: しかし、戦後もフィリピンや香港で日本軍が発行した軍票に強制的に両替させられた住民による、戦後補償を求める訴えがある。
sen.e: However, even after the WWII, in the Philippines and Hong-Kong, some residents who were forced to change their money into the Japanese military currency demanded individual compensation from the Japanese government.

However, even after the WWII, in the Philippines and Hong Kong, some residents who were forced to change their money into the Japanese military currency demanded individual compensation from the Japanese government.

However, even after the WWII, in the Philippines and Hong Kong, some residents who were forced to change their money into the Japanese military currency demanded individual compensation from the Japanese government.

sen.j: 香港では中国中に流通していた日本軍の軍票が一挙に流入させられたため、前述のように強制的に両替させられた住民は大きな経済的損害を受けた。
sen.e: Since Hong Kong had to accept the Japanese military currency circulated in China a brust, the residents who were forced to change their currency into the Japanese military currency were financially damaged.

Since Hong Kong had to accept the Japanese military currency circulated in China a brust, the residents who were forced to change their currency into the Japanese military currency were financially damaged.

Since Hong Kong had to accept the Japanese military currency circulated in China a brust, the residents who were forced to change their currency into the Japanese military currency were financially damaged.

sen.j: 実際に、日本の裁判所で日本政府に対する損失補填を求める民事訴訟が起こされた。
sen.e: In fact, some of them commenced a civil suit in a law court in Japan, demanding individual compensation from the Japanese government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In fact, some of them instituted a civil suit in a court in Japan, demanding individual compensation from the Japanese government.
sen.cmt: commenced→instituted, a law court→a court としました。
sen.e: In fact, some of them instituted a civil suit in a court in Japan, demanding individual compensation from the Japanese government.

sen.j: が、1999年6月17日に東京地方裁判所は、当時の国際法で戦争被害に対する個人の損害を補償しないという原則と、日本の国内法に軍票を交換する法律が存在しないことを理由に請求を棄却した。
sen.e: On June 17, 1999, the Tokyo District Court rejected the plaintiff's claim because of the following reasons; the international law at that time had a principal that individual war damage would not be compensated; Japanese domestic law did not have a legislation that the govenment would exchange the former military currency with other currency.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On June 17, 1999, the Tokyo District Court rejected the plaintiff's claim because of the following reasons; the international law at that time had a principal that individual war damage would not be compensated; Japanese domestic law did not have a legislation that the govenment would exchange the former military currency with other currency.

On June 17, 1999, the Tokyo District Court rejected the plaintiff's claim because of the following reasons; the international law at that time had a principal that individual war damage would not be compensated; Japanese domestic law did not have a legislation that the govenment would exchange the former military currency with other currency.

sen.j: またフィリピン方面で日本軍が発行した軍票のうち、現存するものの中には日本に補償を求めるスタンプを押したものが存在する。
sen.e: Some of the remaining military notes, issued in the areas around the Philippines, had stamps that demanded individual compensation from the Japanese government.
Some of the remaining military currency issued in the areas around the Philippines had stamps that demanded individual compensation from the Japanese government.
sen.cmt: notes→currency としました。コンマを除きました。
sen.e: Some of the remaining military currency issued in the areas around the Philippines had stamps that demanded individual compensation from the Japanese government.

sen.j: これは軍票所持者から信託を受けた団体が受領書を交付し、団体ではスタンプを押して管理するというものであった。
sen.e: That was due to the following system; the organizations trusted by the owners of the military currency issued the receipt and those organizations kept the currency by stamping on each note.
That is because the organizations, which was trusted by the owners of the military currency, issued the receipt and kept the currency by stamping on each note.
sen.cmt: due to the following system→because として後の文を変更しました。
sen.e: That is because the organizations, which was trusted by the owners of the military currency, issued the receipt and kept the currency by stamping on each note.

sen.j: しかし、現在では元の所有者に返され、多くの紙幣収集家の手元に納まっている。
sen.e: Such notes were returned to the former owners, and then were sold to many paper money collecters.
But such notes were returned to the former owners, and were sold to many paper money collecters.
But such notes were returned to the former owners, and were sold to many paper money collecters.

sen.j: オランダ郵政当局が1985年に発行した「第二次世界大戦終結40周年」記念切手3種のうちの1種には、オランダ人が日本の皇居に向けて土下座している姿とともに軍票が描かれていた。
sen.e: In 1985, Dutch State Post Bureau issued three kinds of memorial stamps, 'the 40th anniversary of the end of the WWII'; on one of them, the picture of Dutch people kneeling down on the ground toward Japanese Imperial Palaceand that of military currency were illustrated.
sen.cmt: 「オランダ郵政当局」「第二次世界大戦終結40周年」の定訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: One of three memorial stamps 'the 40th anniversary of the end of the WWII' issued by Dutch State Post Bureau in 1985 shows the picture of Dutch people kneeling down on the ground toward Japanese Imperial Palaceand and the military currency on it.
sen.cmt: 語句の順序を入れ替え、文全体を修正しました。
sen.e: One of three memorial stamps 'the 40th anniversary of the end of the WWII' issued by Dutch State Post Bureau in 1985 shows the picture of Dutch people kneeling down on the ground toward Japanese Imperial Palaceand and the military currency on it.
